content: --अलोकः <ab>N.</ab> of a mythical mountain that encircles the earth and is situated beyond the sea of fresh water which surrounds the last of the seven continents; beyond लोकालोक there is complete darkness, and to this side of it there is light; it thus divides the visible world from the regions of darkness; प्रकाशश्चाप्रकाशश्च लोकालोक इवाचलः <ls>R. 1. 68</ls>; लोकालोकव्याहतं घर्मराशेः शालीनं वा धाम नालं प्रसर्तुं <ls>Śi. 16. 83</ls>; <ls>Mv. 5. 10</ls>, <ls n="Mv. 5.">45</ls>; (for further explanation see Dr. Bhāṇḍārkar's note on l. 79 of <ls>Māl. 10</ls>th Act.). (--कौ the visible and the invisible world.
